CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 20, 1946, pg. 1, reads: "...[ill.] Lucky Veterans and their families moved into the new [...] at McKinley Park Monday afternoon, after a colorful celebration attended by Mayor David L. Lawrence, Housing Administrator [...] Klein, and a number of other city officials. These homes were the first of the 750 veterans' temporary housing unites being constructed throughout the city to be readied for occupancy.  The photos, left to right, show...Another family who is happy to get a home of their own are Mr. and Mrs. Caesar Jones and their children, who look over their kitchen apparatus.  Mrs. Phyllis Young, a secretary with the Veterans Temporary Housing Program, stands by. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Phyllis Young, Caesar Jones, Mrs. Jones and their two children, gathered in kitchen of veteran's housing unit at McKinley Park
